intro: Phyllanthus longiflorus, commonly known as the long-flowered phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain small, dark seeds. Phyllanthus longiflorus is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
